intro: Ctenitopsis glabra, commonly known as the smooth ctenitopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. The smooth, hairless leaves are a distinguishing trait of this species.
